citation.article-title: Globicatella sanguis gen.nov., sp.nov., a new gram-positive catalase-negative bacterium from human sources.

p.s: Description of Globicatella sanguis sp. nov.
Strains produce an ahaemolytic reaction on blood agar.
Acid is produced from glucose, lactose, mannitol, maltose, melibiose, raffinose, ribose, salicin, sorbitol, sucrose and trehalose.
Acid is not produced from arabinose, sorbose or glycerol.
Aesculin, hippurate and starch are hydrolysed.
Tellurite (0.04%) and tetrazolium (0.25%) are not tolerated.
Cell wall murein type is lysine-direct.
The G + C content of DNA of the type strain is 37 mol%, as determined by melting temperature.
Other reference strains are NCFB 2824 (1434-83), NCFB 2826 (1 104-78) and NCFB 2827 (1713-79).
